page.title: 16A SOCIAL CONCERN, GRIMSBY
page.content: Walking down{Church Lane,Old Clee,}I felt as if I was in a small village.It was very quiet,only{1 car}passed in{an {hour}but{5 horses}went by to{Old Clee {Riding School.}Clee is now{part of the {town.}Houses surround it on 3 sides.On the west there are sports fields and{2 {small meadows}where horses graze.Local people{fought}to{protect}this pretty area after houses were built close to the ancient church.Unusual Dutch{gable {cottages}are{protected.}Some have been carefully modernised and enlarged.They were built about 1850 by{the Thorold's {of Weelsby Hall.}They copied the style of{17C Clee Hall.}It was built about 1600. They{still farm}but only{own 5 {acres}now. They have{tried}to{build}on the land{without}success. The{horse {fields}aren't in the area. We{fear} they might be built on and spoil the rural atmosphere.
